FuncDef:
The service bandwidth-overload command configures logical bandwidth on an interface that carries ATM services.
The undo service bandwidth-overload command deletes the logical bandwidth from an interface that carries ATM services.
By default, no logical bandwidth on an interface that carries ATM services is configured.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the logical bandwidth on an interface that carries ATM services.
It is an integer ranging from 0 to 64000000, in kbit/s.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Bandwidth on a physical interface (an IMA group or serial interface) is limited, which restricts the bandwidth allocated to PVCs configured. To maximize PVC bandwidth usage, you can run the service bandwidth-overload command to add logical bandwidth to the interface. After this command is run, the total bandwidth that can be configured on the interface is added.
Bandwidth for PVCs must meet the following requirements:
Bandwidth for each PVC cannot be greater than the physical interface's bandwidth.Total bandwidth for all PVCs must be lower than the sum of the physical bandwidth and logical bandwidth.

Precautions
The service bandwidth-overload is supported only on the main interface.
